phrases: next patient is melissa sanchez... being seen in office today for status post mitral valve repair done on 8/3/2020.
At her previous follow-up on 9/17, we felt that she was doing quite from a cardiac standpoint, and we recommended she continue with the same medication.

I'm still getting some chest pains sometimes, and my breathing gets shallow... if I feel that, if I'm exerting myself, I slow down a bit which helps... episodes last a few minutes... goes away for a couple weeks.
I've been trying to keep up with that. There's a lot of extra pills, but I have a reminder app, I do pretty.
Ecg taken on 12/26/2020 reveals atrial fibrillation with a controlled ventricular response. T-wave inversion anteriorly... no significant changes compared to the previous study.
Head and neck no jvd detected... lungs have reduced breath, but auscultation and percussion are clear... rhythm is irregularly irregular... trace peripheral edema on extremities.
it's when your heart doesn't beat with the correct rhythm, and whatever rhythm it doesn't have a pattern to it... part of the atrial fibrillation.
Coumadin 4 milligrams, lasix at 40 milligrams a day, and the atenolol, you're taking that every day as... 50 milligrams every day.
Continue on your current meds... let's do a followup in about six to nine months.
history of mitral regurgitation and atrial fibrillation, history of diabetes, asthma, and recurrent chest discomfort with negative cardiac workup for coronary artery disease.
